direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods generate HTML strings but differ in whether they include the outer tags of the elements.
Both methods extract content from elements, but 'text()' extracts plain text while 'outerHtml()' extracts HTML.
The 'toString()' method is an alias for 'outerHtml()', making test cases for one applicable to the other.
Both methods manipulate the HTML structure of elements, with 'wrap' adding outer HTML around elements.
Both methods modify the state of elements by altering their HTML structure, though in opposite ways.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing elements with a collection can set up the state needed for 'outerHtml()' to generate correct output.
Wrapping elements before calling 'outerHtml()' can test how the method handles nested structures.
Verifying the HTML structure can ensure that 'outerHtml()' produces the expected output.
